intro: Orthrosanthus multiflorus var. hebecarpus, commonly known as the narrow-fruit orthrosanthus, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, aromatic scent. The unique feature of this variety is its elongated, narrow fruits that mature in late summer.
